item.title: [webaudio] GainNode article recommends against constructor usage
item.content:encoded:
MDN URL: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/GainNode

What information was incorrect, unhelpful, or incomplete?

The GainNode article recommends against using the constructor new GainNode and for using the factory function context.createGain without giving clear reasons.

Specific section or headline?

You shouldn't manually create a gain node; instead, use the method BaseAudioContext.createGain.
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/GainNode#constructor

Note: You should typically call BaseAudioContext.createGain to create a gain node.
– https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/GainNode/GainNode

What did you expect to see?

The constructor new GainNode is now widely supported in the latest browser versions. Noteworthy, the factory function createGain() has a little better browser support, due to having been implemented in Safari for a longer time.

W3C TAG discussions from 2013 indicate that the constructor should be preferred over the factory function because it allows subclassing, allows understanding how construction works, is more idiomatic and allows easy passing in of arguments.

Did you test this? If so, how?

item.title: [webaudio] Content bug: AudioListener and attributes need better examples.
item.content:encoded:
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AudioListener

As discussed in #4401 (comment) AudioListener and all the attributes link to the same example https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/PannerNode#examples

This is not actually all that relevant to all the attributes, and is probably more comprehensive than required at this level. It would be better to have small focussed example for each of these and cross link to the example as a see also.

item.title: [webmidi] Issue with "MIDIMessageEvent": deprecated example method
item.content:encoded:
MDN URL: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MIDIMessageEvent

What information was incorrect, unhelpful, or incomplete?

This code snippet at the end of the article invokes a deprecated method:

// Printing all messages to console
navigator.requestMIDIAccess().then(midiAccess => {
Array.from(midiAccess.inputs).forEach(input => {
input[1].onmidimessage = (msg) => { console.log(msg); }
})
});

Specific section or headline?

Examples

What did you expect to see?

a snippet that will work in my browser or a link to how to construct a well formed expression to do as much. My chrome version is Version 89.0.4389.90 (Official Build) (64-bit)

Did you test this? If so, how?

copy and pasted in console and this was the output:

VM38:1 [Deprecation] Web MIDI will ask a permission to use even if the sysex is not specified in the MIDIOptions since around M82, around May 2020. See https://www.chromestatus.com/feature/5138066234671104 for more details.

item.title: [webaudio] Visualization for OscillatorNode
item.content:encoded:
@VoloshchenkoAl commented on Wed Jan 13 2021

I have started to learn about OscillatorNode, and find out that it is difficult to understand how the frequency and type of Oscillator affects a sound wave.

Is it a good idea to add visualization for OscillatorNode documentation? It will help to better understand how OscillatorNode works.

Example of visualization — https://codepen.io/VoloshchenkoAl/pen/gOwdpKx
